Join.definition: to unite so as to form one unit [ the claims in one action] 2 a

1.definition: to come together so as to form a unit [the other victims of the schemein the suit]

2 a.definition: to align oneself with esp. in a legal matter [sheher husband as plaintiff]

sub_terms.b: to cause or order (a person) to become a party to a lawsuit [if the person has not been so, the court shall order that the person be made a party "Rule 19(a)"] compare,,,
sub_terms.c: to enter into or participate in [ the suit]

2 a.ed: the court shall order that the person be made a party

2.definition: to commence involvement or participation [if the person should as a plaintiff but refuses to do so, the person may be made a defendant, orâ€¦an involuntary plaintiff "Rule 19(a)"]
